description:
I've just read the blog post at Jetbrains blog, and finally wayland support is going to come with next 2024.2 update (I hope).
This is big issue if UHD screen is used with wayland.
https://blog.jetbrains.com/platform/2024/07/wayland-support-preview-in-2024-2/
summary: Finally Wayland Support On The Way

description: I believe that the issue plaguing these other reviewers has been fixed by Pycharm, this software has been working perfecly for me and I believe that it is now Fedora compatible.

Flatpaks are very bad, wasted hours till I figured out that flatpak sandbox is an issue why I can't use installed by me python executable, it doesn't even see files or folders that it needs. Don't know why Linux developers hate linux users.

Please, ensure that you really need this IDE, if you are going to buy license.
It's much more powerful than Community version, but for me even Community version is overpowered. I am sure that I won't use 99% of the features, but I got a free license because I am a student, so why not?
I had a look on the website and they do not make this very clear, so I assume it is for trial.
Everything works fine.
Access to the entire home directory
summary: Access to the entire home directory

description: $159.00 for the first year.

Flatpak seems to have an internal file system and the Python version is different. Many commands are not available from the PyCharm terminal, which makes everything to fail. Do NOT install this using Flatpak.
summary: Flatpak messes up the virtual env

description:
It installs with its own version of Python (3.7) and then somehow overlays that onto your filesystem (I'm unfamiliar with the mechanics of Flatpak) such that it running `python --version` inside PyCharm gives you 3.7 even when your system only had 3.9.

This wouldn't be a problem were it not for the fact that virtualenvs built outside of Pycharm (like when you're doing things on the command line) have no knowledge of this special internal-only-to-Pycharm copy of Python, so you can't have PyCharm reference virtualenvs you build on the CLI. You just keep getting "SDK seems invalid" errors.
summary: I love PyCharm, but the Flatpak installation is unusable

description: La verdad no lo uso muy profundamente solo para cosas basicas pero me sirve mucho

You have python 3.10 installed? You wont be able to use it/see it, even in your filesystem - what you see in your terminal is completely different from what Pycharm sees. Took me a while to find that the people have similar issues. AVOID.
summary: Messes up the virtual environments to no end

description: You have python 3.11 installed? You wont be able to use it/see it, even in your file system - what you see in your terminal is completely different from what Pycharm sees. Took me a while to find that the people have similar issues. I installed Visual Studio and immediately it recognized python 3.11. It is an internal problem with pycharm.
summary: PyCharm will not recognize python 3.10 or 3.11 at all

description: Use Pycharm for work. This is not a review of a product. Instaling Pycharm using flatpak for me always leads to bugs that make it unusable. Right now for some reason flatpak version doesn't except virtual envronment created not for main version of python but older one.

The flatpak package is broken, due to the sandbox basic stuff doesen't work you can't even use the termina.

Install directly using a tarbal or switch to Ubuntu I guess...

This is really an IDE that supports programming in a smart way. Superb autocompletion, hotkey, search features. I dont want to miss it. I personally do not need the Professional (paid) version features for my projects.
Мощный IDE! Только сильно жрет ОЗУ (
Эт че пиратка?
Оценить бесплатно 30 дней ( Evaluete for free 30 day ).
Невозможно создать виртуальное окружение с нужной версией Python

Cannot connect to already running IDE instance.
Exception: Process 2 is still running
Санкционный продукт, долой из репозитория.
Не видит установленных интерпретаторов. Но при этом видит НЕ установленный интерпретатор.
